Name: Relief of Nefer-Hotep and Son
Description: This relief is carved on a framed slab. It depicts Nefer-Hotep standing and wearing a leopard skin as a sign of his priestly rank. In front of him stands his son, who is embracing the leg of his father. The upper frame is inscribed with the names and titles of the deceased, who was a scribe and a priest. An offering formula is also inscribed.
